alert.note: Alert for Annette Island; City and Borough of Wrangell; Ketchikan Gateway Borough; Petersburg Borough; Prince of Wales Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 23 at 5:59AM AKST until February 25 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...SNOW BEGINNING THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY... .A strengthening low will move into the NE gulf Thursday evening with an associated front moving over the panhandle Friday morning. Dry snow will begin in the Yakutat area, then spreading from north to south across the panhandle. Some uncertainty exists regarding snow totals due to limited moisture available, particularly for the northern inner channels around Haines and Skagway. For most areas the greatest snowfall rates will be Friday evening. ...WINTER STORM WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 12 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Southern Panhandle, including: Petersburg, Wrangell, Prince of Wales Island, Ketchikan, and Annette Island. * WHEN...From Friday afternoon through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Friday evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light, dry, snow will fall during the day Friday, then greater rates are expected Friday evening. Some mixing with rain is possible late Friday night along the outer coast of Prince of Wales and Annette Islands.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
